meanings.definition: Able to be replaced or exchanged by another identical item.
meanings.sent1: The toy cars were fungible, so the children could easily swap them.
meanings.sent2: In the game, players can trade their fungible resources for different ones.
meanings.sent3: The fungible puzzle pieces magically transformed into different shapes when swapped.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as fungible as water, flowing from one idea to the next effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The fungible keys opened multiple doors, each leading to a new adventure.

meanings.sent1: The batteries in the remote control were fungible, so any brand would work.
meanings.sent2: The fungible parts of the machine could easily be switched out for new ones.
meanings.sent3: His socks were so fungible that he often wore mismatched pairs without noticing.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was as fungible as a deck of cards, easily shuffled and redistributed.
meanings.sent5: The fungible ingredients in the recipe allowed for easy substitutions without altering the taste.

meanings.sent1: The fungible tokens in the game could be traded for various rewards.
meanings.sent2: Currency is fungible, meaning you can exchange one bill for another of the same value.
meanings.sent3: The fungible paint colors blended together to create a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were as fungible as the changing seasons, always in flux.
meanings.sent5: The fungible tickets could be used for entry to any of the attractions in the park.
